verses.kjv: When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died.
verses.ct: There was a time when Ephraim spoke, people trembled — he held a position of honor in Israel. But when he became guilty of worshiping Baal, he brought death upon himself.

verses.kjv: And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
verses.ct: Now they keep sinning more and more. They cast silver idols for themselves, images designed by their own imagination, all of it the product of skilled metalworkers. They say about these idols, 'Let those who offer sacrifices kiss the calves.'

verses.kjv: Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud, and as the early dew that passeth away, as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the floor, and as the smoke out of the chimney.
verses.ct: Because of this, they will vanish like a morning cloud, like early dew that disappears, like husks blown by the wind from the threshing floor, like smoke rising from a window.

verses.kjv: Yet I am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt, and thou shalt know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me.
verses.ct: "Yet I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt. You must not acknowledge any god except me, because there is no savior apart from me."

verses.kjv: I did know thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.
verses.ct: "I cared for you in the wilderness, in that scorching, dry land."

verses.kjv: According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten me.
verses.ct: "When they found good pasture, they ate until they were full. Once they were full, they became proud, and so they forgot me."

verses.kjv: Therefore I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe them:
verses.ct: "So I will be like a lion to them. Like a leopard, I will lurk beside the road, watching them."

verses.kjv: I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps, and will rend the caul of their heart, and there will I devour them like a lion: the wild beast shall tear them.
verses.ct: "I will attack them like a mother bear robbed of her cubs. I will tear open their chests, and right there I will consume them like a lion. Wild animals will rip them apart."

verses.kjv: O Israel, thou hast destroyed thyself; but in me is thine help.
verses.ct: "Israel, you have destroyed yourself, but your help is found in me."

verses.kjv: I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes?
verses.ct: "Where is your king now? Let him rescue you in all your cities! Where are your rulers, about whom you said, 'Give me a king and leaders'?"

verses.kjv: I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in my wrath.
verses.ct: "I gave you a king in my anger, and I took him away in my fury."

verses.kjv: The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; his sin is hid.
verses.ct: "Ephraim's guilt is stored up; his sin is kept on record."

verses.kjv: The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long in the place of the breaking forth of children.
verses.ct: "Labor pains will overtake him. He is a foolish child, because when the time comes for birth, he refuses to come out of the womb."

verses.kjv: I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be thy plagues; O grave, I will be thy destruction: repentance shall be hid from mine eyes.
verses.ct: "I will rescue them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death. Death, where are your plagues? Grave, where is your destruction? I will show no change of heart."

verses.kjv: Though he be fruitful among his brethren, an east wind shall come, the wind of the LORD shall come up from the wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up: he shall spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.
verses.ct: Even though Ephraim flourishes among his brothers, an east wind will come — the wind of the LORD rising up from the desert. His springs will run dry, and his wells will be emptied. That wind will plunder his storehouse of every precious thing.

verses.kjv: Samaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled against her God: they shall fall by the sword: their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up.
verses.ct: Samaria will face its punishment, because she has rebelled against her God. They will be killed by the sword. Their infants will be smashed to pieces, and their pregnant women will be torn open.
